dataset.title: Dendrometer Data for Trees in Gentry Plots at CWT, HFR, BCI, LUQ, HJA, and NWT

para.literalLayout: Patterns of biodiversity, such as the increase toward the tropics and the peaked curve during ecological succession, are fundamental phenomena for ecology. Such patterns have multiple, interacting causes, but temperature emerges as a dominant factor across organisms from microbes to trees and mammals, and across terrestrial, marine, and freshwater environments. However, there is little consensus on the underlying mechanisms, even as global temperatures increase and the need to predict their effects becomes more pressing. The purpose of this project is to generate and test theory for how temperature impacts biodiversity through its effect on biochemical processes and metabolic rate. A combination of standardized surveys in the field and controlled experiments in the field and laboratory measure diversity of three taxa -- trees, invertebrates, and microbes -- and key biogeochemical processes of decomposition in seven forests distributed along a geographic gradient of increasing temperature from cold temperate to warm tropical. This dataset contains dendrometer data for trees in the five Gentry subplots at each experimental site. These plots were installed by the Enquist Lab and the University of Arizona as part of this macrosystems biodiversity and latitude project supported by the National Science Foundation under Cooperative Agreement DEB#1065836.

Dendrometer Measurement Protocol 1. Record the date 2. Record the time of day-morning, afternoon, late afternoon, etc. for each plot. It is important to measure the same plot around the same time of day for each measurement. 3. Measure the distance between the overlapped end of the band and the right-hand side of the window using the caliper, record value in mm under the column "window after modification." For this measurement, make sure to use the inside jaws (not the outside jaws) of the caliper. 4. Measure the final DTN (distance to nail or hash), place the value in the column "dist_mm" 5. Write any notes in the comments column. Especially, if it rained recently or if it is raining when the measurements are being taken, it is important to know if it is a light drizzle all day, a light drizzle for an hour, or a hard rain the day before the measurement. Also note if the band has moved or slipped. Important: 1. Always double check that the caliper is set to mm, not inches. 2. It is best to avoid rain, but given your time constraints and the importance of maintaining a reasonable biweekly schedule, we understand that measurements will have to be taken during or following a rain event. Just be sure to note when the date rain occurred and how heavy it was. 3. If a band comes loose or falls off, please make a note of it in the comments column and re-secure it.

dataTable.entityName: Dendrometer Data for Trees in Gentry Plots at CWT, HFR, BCI, LUQ, HJA, and NWT
dataTable.entityDescription: Dendrometer data from select trees in Gentry Plots at each macrosystems site (CWT, HFR, BCI, LUQ, HJA, and NWT).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Three letter code of site where samples were collected (cwt = Coweeta LTER, hfr = Harvard Forest LTER, luq = Luquillo LTER, hja = HJ Andrews LTER, nwt = Niwot Ridge LTER, bci = Barro Colorado Island)

textDomain.definition: Three letter code of site where samples were collected (cwt = Coweeta LTER, hfr = Harvard Forest LTER, luq = Luquillo LTER, hja = HJ Andrews LTER, nwt = Niwot Ridge LTER, bci = Barro Colorado Island)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Includes site name and associated Gentry plot number, for example, NWTT1 represents Gentry Plot 1 at Niwot Ridge LTER.

textDomain.definition: Includes site name and associated Gentry plot number, for example, NWTT1 represents Gentry Plot 1 at Niwot Ridge LTER.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Each Gentry plot has 10 50m line transects, denoted as lines 1-10. All transect lines are from south to north.

textDomain.definition: Each Gentry plot has 10 50m line transects, denoted as lines 1-10. All transect lines are from south to north.

attribute.attributeDefinition: ENQ_Tag_# or LTER_Tag_# (if LTER tag was already in place that number was used by the Enquist Lab). All multi-stemmed individuals were measured if greater than 1 cm DBH and the largest individual was tagged for Niwot and Coweeta 2011. All other sites individual stems were tagged and measured separately follow CTFS protocol.

textDomain.definition: ENQ_Tag_# or LTER_Tag_# (if LTER tag was already in place that number was used by the Enquist Lab). All multi-stemmed individuals were measured if greater than 1 cm DBH and the largest individual was tagged for Niwot and Coweeta 2011. All other sites individual stems were tagged and measured separately follow CTFS protocol.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Genus matched with current genera found in Tropicos.org

textDomain.definition: Genus matched with current genera found in Tropicos.org

attribute.attributeDefinition: Species matched with species names used in Tropicos.org

textDomain.definition: Species matched with species names used in Tropicos.org

attribute.attributeDefinition: Diameter at Breast Height in centimeters using small cm DBH tape.
The year in which the measurement was taken.

textDomain.definition: The year in which the measurement was taken.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The date on which the measurement was taken
The ordinal date on which the measurement was taken (1-365 or 366)

textDomain.definition: The ordinal date on which the measurement was taken (1-365 or 366)

attribute.attributeDefinition: The time at which the measurement was taken. May be nominal (morning, afternoon) or clock time.

textDomain.definition: The time at which the measurement was taken. May be nominal (morning, afternoon) or clock time.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Distance to nail or hash if there was a second one present
Any field notes pertaining to the measurement.

textDomain.definition: Any field notes pertaining to the measurement.
